page.title: 15Customs of Blithfield
page.content: Blithfield Hall has a strong connection with Abbots Bromley village. Once a year, in September, men from th village carry reindeer horns on their shoulders and perform the Horn Dance in Aots Bromley and surounding district. They have always stopped at the Hall to dance and receive refreshment at lunchtime. The custom is thought to date from pre-christian times. The goats head is the Bagot faimly crest and was first used by Sir John Bagot. According to family tradition goats were presented by King Richard 11 in appreciation of good hunting in Bagot Park. The goats ae of the Scharzhals or black neck breed and were probably brrought to England by the Crusaders. Until recently the goats could be seen in the park. they are now in a rare breeds farm in Devon.
